comments:
Using I20050419-1200 on Linux-GTK, I get an NPE when I try to view an HTML file
in an external browser:

at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:935)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.browser.ExternalBrowserInstance.openURL(ExternalBrowserInstance.java:49)
at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.browser.WebBrowserEditor.doOpenExternalEditor(WebBrowserEditor.java:338)
at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.browser.WebBrowserEditor.access$0(WebBrowserEditor.java:294)
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.browser.WebBrowserEditor$2.run(WebBrowserEditor.java:286)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:118)
... 18 more

Found several possible causes of this problem, mostly when the current external
web browser is not set:

* This could happen on the first launch of the browser in some cases - will
provide a default current external browser to avoid this
* Could happen if the current external browser is deleted in the preference -
will set the current browser to one of the remaining browsers

In cases where there are no external browsers found on the system, or if the
user has deleted all of them, a PartInitException will be thrown that should
already be handled by the code launching the web browser.
